dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A garish Jose Cuervo ad flashes by on the side of a brigh yellow HUMMER as it drives through frame, pulling CAMERA the mid-summer crush of semi-clad, youthful bodies on mai street Lake Havasu, Arizona. Havasu is an overcrowded blue collar summer paradise at t peak of its three-month-a-year run of prosperity. You can almost smell the sunscreen as heat waves make the crowd o the pavement appear to waver like a mirage in the desert. Main street is a row of tourist trap t-shirt shops, bars coffee shops and cafes. Beyond lies the shimmering expans of the lake itself. CRANE SHOT ENDS as a four wheel drive pick-up pulls into foreground. A sign on the side of the truck reads “Patter Bait and Dive Shop.” A beautiful golden retriever, BAXTER bounds out of the open truck bed, barking merrily. TED PATTERSON and JULIE TUPPER step out of the cab. They’ one of those golden couples who have the ease and confide of two people who are perfect for each other. They are bronzed, athletic, early thirties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bell mounted on the front door JINGLES merrily as Julie enters with Baxter bounding close at her heels. The Proprietor, NATE HASKEL, is a pleasant, if forgettable, middle-aged man, idly surfing the web on his laptop. He rises as they enter.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Hi, Ted. Hi, Miss Tupper. Can you believe this heat?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Pretty miserable, but it’s good for business.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (sighs) Not mine. Tourists usually don’t bring pets... and they don’t think much about taking one home. what can I do for you today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a bag of dry food and a couple of those rawhide chews.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You’re a lucky dog, Baxter. Baxter barks in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (gathers goods) So, the big day’s coming right up, isn’t it? Julie and Ted share a warm glance.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Only three weeks.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: You trying to get me nervous, Nate?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Well, some of us wouldn’t mind if you got cold feet. You got the prettiest girl in Havasu.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: That’s sweet, Nate.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: That’1l be twenty-two thirty-five. (as Ted pays) You know, those Balinese fighting fish should be in next week.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (skeptical) Balinese fighting fish?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: They’re beautiful, hon. wait ‘til you see ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Sounds like they’1l eat everything else in the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, they come with their own environment.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I heard the Sumatras are more aggressive than the Balinese.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Maybe so, but I wouldn’t recommend them. They’re much more sensitive to the PH balance. There’s a website here somewhere... Nate punches up the website on laptop.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (takes Baxter) You two chat, I’ve got to get back to the dock. Your brother’s the only one minding the store.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: That’s trouble. She gives him a quick kiss.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: And don’t forget, you’ve got a dive at one o’clock with that dot com guy.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (chuckles) The great white hunter. How could I forget?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Just don’t let him spear you in that cute tush. Julie pinches Ted’s jeans-clad butt.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Hey, easy...

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (waves as she exits) Thanks, Nate!

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Oh, anytime, Miss Tupper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie. (big smile) Or Mrs. Patterson.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Okay, Mrs. Patterson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An isolated inlet. This is the remote end of Havasu... breathtaking red rock terrain sculpted by time itself. No much has changed here in ten thousand years... CAMERA BOOMS DOWN to reveal Ted standing waist-deep in th water, wearing a full wet suit and diving gear. MR. CROUS a slightly pudgy yuppie with a tourist’s sunburn waits be Ted as he checks his spear gun.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: The grouper like to feed in these inlets this time of day. Remember it’s all about your approach.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CROUSE
dialogues.text: Cool. I’m a human shadow. Lead the way. Ted slips on his dive mask, sucks in his mouth piece, and submerges with barely a ripple. Crouse follows with an awkward SPLASH. As they disappear beneath the surface, CAMERA pushes past them to the nearby shore... where an old TIRE SWING is ti off to an oak tree. All is silent and still. Beat. Then the tire slowly begins to swing. At first, almost imperceptibly. Then in a widening arc, as if it hada ghostly rider. The barren branches of the entire tree beg to TREMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: ROCK FORMATIONS
dialogues.text: The ground begins to SHAKE. Several fist-sized rocks tumb down the slopes as we hear the growing RUMBLE of an earthquake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People in the streets react as the tremor hits Havasu. A pitcher of beer SMASHES to the sidewalk at an outdoor caf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs HOWL and parrakeets FLAP in their cages. Nate manage to catch a fish bowl just as it tips off a counter top.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Patterson and Crouse are tossed about beneath the surface a churning backwash of water. The rocky slope at the bottom of the lake SHAKES violentl Then a jagged crack travels up the slope like an inverse lightning bolt... and a_twenty foot rift in the floor of lake cracks open. There is a deafening ROAR of water and both men are viole sucked into the rift... followed by tons of sand and rock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie rises to her feet, screw driver in one greasy hand, spark plug in the other. JACOB WYATT is assisting her. He a tough-as-nails ex-longshoreman in his sixties. The boat they’re working on begins BANGING against the do pylons. Julie grips the gunnels to steady herself. Then it’s over as suddenly as it started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate waits a beat, then sets the fish bowl safely back do The parrakeets PEEP angrily, but settle back in their cag

dialogues.speaker: C.U. TED
dialogues.text: He struggles to orientate himself in pitch darkness. He’s alive... but where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted CLICKS on a flashlight and the beam reveals a dark mo SHADOW whirling straight towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie rises as the boat steadies itself. ZACK PATTERSON, Ted’s younger brother, bursts out of the dive shop and crosses to Julie. Zack’s a tattooed twenty-year-old with curious charm about him.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: You okay, Julie?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Was that an earthquake?

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: (gets back to work) Hell, that was nothing but a hiccup. I’ve been in an earthquake. MARCUS (20s), Zack’s co-worker, joins them.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Let me guess, that one with Moses, right? When he parted the red sea. Wasn’t Pharaoh after you guys? Jacob is clearly used to Marcus’ dry humor.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, it was the San Fran quake in ‘89. Little puss like you would have shit his heart straight into his tighty whities.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Zack, is your brother still out on that dive?

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Yeah. Wonder if he felt anything... CAMERA PUSHES into a CLOSE UP of Julie as a hint of conce crosses her features.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try him on the radio, will you?

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO BLACK
dialogues.text: Images briefly FLASH against the darkness, like the flick of lightning. A RUMBLE of thunder accompanies each image; FLASH #1 - EXT. LAKE - TED’S BOAT - SUNSET Julie frantically inspects Ted’s empty boat, which floats adrift. Zack and Jacob tie their boat off to Ted’s.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Two state owned Fish and Game boats ROAR along the shorel A grim-faced SEARCH TEAM scans the darkness with powerful spot lights. Julie and Zack ride in the back of the lead boat.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BLACK
dialogues.text: FLASH #3 - INT. TED’S CABIN - NIGHT Julie, surrounded by Ted’s family and friends, breaks dow tears. Zack reacts with anger and frustration, SMASHING h glass in the fire place.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BLACK
dialogues.text: TITLES FADE UP - “THREE DAYS LATER” INT. SHERIFF DOBBS’ OFFICE - LATE AFTERNOON A cluttered Fish and Game Department office. SHERIFF JIM DOBBS, late fifties, is a seasoned enforcement veteran; a good man whose simply been at this job too long to believ he’s going to save anybody but himself and his pension. He sits across the desk from Julie Tupper, who has learne believe the same about him.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: We’ve had our resources maxed out for days now. I can’t justify it any longer.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You’re calling the search off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no choice. Fourth of July is the busiest weekend of the year. Maybe after the holiday...

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Maybe what?! He could still be alive out there.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: He certainly could. In fact, I’d bet money on it. But not in Havasu, maybe not even in Arizona.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Look, I don’t want to upset you anymore than I have to...

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: It’s a little late for sensitivity.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Ted Patterson was a better diver than any man on my search team. There’s no way he drowned in Lake Havasu. (beat) The truth is, there’s no evidence that there was any kind of accident at all.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: We found his boat adrift!

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Which makes it seem pretty damn strange that we haven’t found a body by now. (pauses) Your wedding was supposed to be in two weeks, correct?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What are you getting at?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: We have to consider all the possibilities. One of them is that Ted simply left town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That’s ridiculous!

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: You want to tell me what’s more likely? Alien abduction?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: How do you explain the businessman Ted was diving with...?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: We still have no record of this “Mr. Crouse.” None of the hotels had him registered. No one’s turned up to inquire about him.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: So, what... you don’t believe me?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: I know this is difficult for you.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You’re difficult for me.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: (ice cold) We’re done for today, Miss Tupper.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You were done before you even started, weren’t you Sheriff? (rises) I guess I can’t blame you, this is such a busy time of year for you. Must be hard to keep up with all those fishing licenses. Julie storms out and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob is waiting for her, standing beside the dive shop p He knows the story from the look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (enters passenger’s side) Don’t ask.  10.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: They’re just glorified park rangers, Julie. Even if Dobbs wanted to help, he couldn’t find his own ass with two hands and a flashlight. Julie slides into the passenger seat, the entire weight o the tragedy on her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What do you think happened to him, Jacob?

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Anything can happen in the water. Anything. I don’t care if it’s six feet or sixty.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (searches for the words) But Ted was... he was the best.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: I know. I taught him. Jacob cranks the engine, reaches under the seat and hands Julie a coffee thermos.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Coffee’s the last thing I need.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: It ain’t coffee. As Jacob pulls out, Julie unscrews the cap and sniffs. Th vapors alone makes her eyes water.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Go ahead, it won’t make you feel any worse. Julie thinks it over... then she takes a deep swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pick-up swings out and passes by a traffic jam of incoming tourists. A large red, white and blue banner is strung across main street. It reads “Happy Independence D From Lake Havasu City Council.”  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Posters for “Havasu’s Fourth of July Fireworks Extravagan adorn the building. The dock is busy with a variety of college kids and vacationing families.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAYLOR BILLINGS enters the shop like he owns the place. H a trust fund kid with a rocker ponytail, streaked with be salon highlights. He’s accompanied by REGGIE TRIPP, a frat type with a gym physique, Reggie’s girlfriend, SYDNEY (hot and knows it) her college roomies CAMILLE and J.C. Camille talks on her cell phone as she aimlessly wanders about the shop. The girls are pretty, but there’s something special about quiet one, J.C. Zack notices her right away.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Hi. Can I help you guys?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We want to rent tanks, regulators, the works.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: Light gear. Just for a little sport diving.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Great. Are you certified?

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: I’m a Navy Seal, man.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: Yes, really.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Still gotta know if you’re certified.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: (getting irritated) I’m certified, alright?  12.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Then you’ve got a card...?

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: I got this. Reggie pulls up his sleeve and flexes. There is an impressive Navy Seals tattoo on his bicep.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: (in Zack’s face) You can read, right?

dialogues.speaker: SYDNEY
dialogues.text: C’mon Reggie. Please don’t start.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: (to girls) What about you guys? Ever dive before? J.C. Just some snorkeling. But I’d like to learn.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: I can take care of them. I’m an instructor too.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: (sighs) Right. Look, if they want to dive, they need to get certified. Takes about a week. Maybe you should do it too, y’know. Just to brush up. Taylor intercedes, pulling out a Gucci money clip loaded fifties.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We’re only in town for a couple of days. I’1ll pay double. Like a rush fee.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Can’t do that. Julie enters from the back of the shop, senses trouble ri away .

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What’s going on, Zack?  13.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Gear rentals. I got it. It’s okay. Zack sets down a clipboard with a rental form on it.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: If you really want to dive, I can take you guys out myself. As long as I accompany you, one quick lesson and you’re good to go.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: It’s a scam.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: It’s the law. If you don’t like it, that’s okay. There’s lots of other things to do in Havasu.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: (eyes Julie) Why don’t you take us out?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Zack’s the best. If you like, we also do tours on our glass bottom boat. Stay dry and see some spectacular underwater life.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: That shit’s for tourists.

dialogues.speaker: SYDNEY
dialogues.text: Come on, Reggie. Don’t be a dick. Let’s go on the dive. Camille finally finishes her phone call.

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE
dialogues.text: Screw this, you guys. We can just hangout on the houseboat. J.C. smiles at Zack. Something’s going on between the two them. J.C. No. Let’s try it. It’d be cool. Sydney squeezes Reggie’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: SYDNEY
dialogues.text: C’mon, baby.  14.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: (shrugs) What the hell...

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Best time’s early. Like seven a.m.

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE
dialogues.text: Gawd. Are you serious? This is supposed to be a vacation.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: He’s right. The lake’1l be calm. Good visibility. Good dive will take you ‘til lunch. We supply sandwiches and sodas. Taylor lays down his platinum card.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Can you stock some Coronas?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Only for after the dive. (aside, to Zack) You sure you want to take these guys out? They seem like a handful. Zack glances up at J.C. and catches her looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: It’1l be okay.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: If they don’t shape up during the lesson, promise me you’1l1 pull the plug.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: You got my word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls and guys walk to their cars.

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE
dialogues.text: I can’t believe it. You liked that guy. J.C. No way.  15.

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE
dialogues.text: Bullshit. I know you, J.C. J.C. Alright, he was cute. So what?

dialogues.speaker: SYDNEY
dialogues.text: He’s a loser townie, J.C. And if you start hanging out with one of the locals it makes us all look like sluts.

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE
dialogues.text: Two more weeks and we’re back at school. You can wait ‘til then to get revenge on Chad. J.C. I don’t want revenge on Chad.

dialogues.speaker: SYDNEY
dialogues.text: Of course you do. He dumped you in front of the entire school.

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE
dialogues.text: Besides, nothing’s better than revenge sex. That’1ll get Chad jealous and he’1ll want you back. Then you get to have great make-up sex. And after that, you’1l finally be over Chad, so you can be the one to dump him. Perfect, right? J.C. Camille... are you still seeing that therapist?

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE
dialogues.text: No. My mom started dating him, so it kinda seemed like I was talking to my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack watches J.C. through the dive shop window. MARCUS, Zack’s co-worker, enters lugging a pair of tanks through

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: See something you like?  16.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: I dunno.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: They’re Arizona State girls, Zack. They’re all looking for some preppie asshole with a Porsche and a trust fund. That ain’t us.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: True.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Any word on your brother? Zack hangs his head.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: He’s gonna turn up, Zack. You did everything you could, so...

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) Let’s drop it, okay?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... Marcus reaches into his back pocket, pulls out a flyer...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Here. Concentrate on this. It’s for a Fourth of July party.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Club Zanzabar?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I made a deal with Rodriguez to use the Sand Bar. If I turn a profit, I’1l get to do it every Wednesday night. I’m a club promoter now, man.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: You can call it what you want. It’s still the Sand Bar. The place’s got fleas.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I got a D.J. out of Vegas. Guy’s smokin’ hot. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS(cont'd) The place will be packed and not with those stuck up college bitches, either. Zack takes a last glance out the window at the girls. The climb into Taylor’s big Mercedes and peel out. Looks like fun and money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The orange rim of the sun dips beneath the horizon line. The exact moment it’s snuffed out like a candle... nightf The water is calm. Beat. A TURBULENCE begins just beneath the dark surface... doze and dozens of source points swirl about. One split second of activity, then the strange phenomenon over as if it never happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two tourists, a teenage boy and girl, ride along on horseback, passing a joint back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Let’s stop for awhile. There’s supposed to be an old boathouse a little ways up this trail. The girl giggles and passes the joint back.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Okay, but you have to catch me first! The girl kicks her horse in the flanks and it takes off l a bolt of lightning. The boy wheels around and pursues at full gallop.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Amy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl is a hell of a rider. She rides at a full gallop straight toward the lake, laughing wildly. Youth plus dop and horse power. Always trouble.  18. The horse plunges straight into the lake. KER-SPLASH! Probably feels good on this hot night. The boy reigns his horse in at the shoreline.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Amy, get back here!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Come and get me! wWhat’s wrong, scared of the water? She and the horse are now chugging along in deeper water, following the shoreline. The boy kicks his horse’s flanks but it spooks at the water line, refuses to go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy has reached the abandoned boathouse. The dilapidated pier is half-submerged in the inlet. An old tire swing ha from a dead tree. The same tire swing where Ted was sucke under. Now we know exactly where we are... and it’s nota good place to be. Amy can hear the boy calling.

dialogues.speaker: AAAMMMMYYYY
dialogues.text: She reigns her horse in and pats him on the neck. He stan in the water, up to his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What do you think? Should we go back...? The horse WHINNIES deep in its throat. Something is spook him. Amy follows the horse’s fearful gaze. AMY’S P.O.V. - THE WATER The strange DISTURBANCE appears on the moonlit surface. Dozens, maybe hundreds of churning points of contact. But this time they move with purpose, traveling directly at A The entire formation submerges as it races straight at he The horse rears up in panic. Amy tries desperately to rei him in.  19.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No, Stormy!

dialogues.speaker: THE BOY
dialogues.text: He hears the horses frantic WHINNY and realizes something deeply wrong. He kicks his horse into a gallop along the rocky shoreline.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO AMY
dialogues.text: Her horse is clambering for a foothold, still up to its shoulders in the water. Amy is fighting to control him wi all her might.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No, Stormy, no! MYSTERY P.O.V. Eerie SONAR VISION scans the horse beneath the surface as struggles to get it’s footing. The P.O.V. picks up speed, rocketing straight at its inte target.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHORE
dialogues.text: At a full gallop, somehow knowing, fearing just how bad t could be. He hears Amy SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: The water all around her suddenly ERUPTS with blood and bubbles. The horse BRAYS in agony, thrashing violently against an unseen enemy. It collapses into the churning water, taking Amy with it.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOY
dialogues.text: Finally gallops up to Amy’s location. He dismounts and rushes to the edge of the water. But there’s no sign of the horse or Amy.

dialogues.speaker: SHOCK CUT
dialogues.text: The horse breaks the surface, it’s a LIVING NIGHTMARE of flesh stripped down to the bone, yet it’s somehow still alive; it’s eyes rolled back in agony. Amy is coughing water, clutching in blind fear to the saddle horn.  20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SCREAMS hysterically as her horse is literally torn t pieces beneath her... she tumbles with it, straight back into the deadly broiling water. The boy flies out of the darkness on the tire swing... He grabs Amy around the waist and swings to safety as the ho finally collapses beneath the surface. All this has happened without ever revealing a glimpse of ungodly force that pulled the horse under.

dialogues.speaker: SHORELINE
dialogues.text: The boy and Amy hit the ground hard as they land on the r shoreline. He scrambles to his feet, holding her tightly.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Amy, are you okay? She does not reply. By the vacant look on her blood- splattered face we realize she may never be okay again.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Amy?! 1!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful sunlit dawn. Julie detaches the gas line from large, expensive looking houseboat. MRS. TUNNIE, a middle aged woman with oversized accessories (hat, ear rings sunglasses) steps up to the rail.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TUNNIE
dialogues.text: So sorry to hear about Ted. A terrible tragedy. But he was a real sportsman, wasn’t he? So he liked taking those risks.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (pauses) It’s still kinda tough to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TUNNIE
dialogues.text: Oh, I understand. (beat) So, you must be starting to think about moving on by now...  21.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TUNNIE
dialogues.text: Well, now that Ted is gone aren’t you going back to Vegas?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I’m not from Las Vegas, Mrs. Tunnie. I’m from L.A.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TUNNIE
dialogues.text: Really? I heard you were a show girl or something.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I was a realtor.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TUNNIE
dialogues.text: Only danced part time?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (gives up) That’s fifty-six thirty-nine, Mrs. Tunnie.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TUNNIE
dialogues.text: (pays) . So you’re going to stay in town after all?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Yes, actually, I am. Ted’s dad needs me to run the dock.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TUNNIE
dialogues.text: Well, tell him my husband will take this old dock off his hands whenever he’s ready to sell.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: This dock has been in Ted’s family for years.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TUNNIE
dialogues.text: That may be so, but you’re not.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TUNNIE
dialogues.text: You’re not part of Ted’s family are you? Not really. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. TUNNIE(cont'd) And now that Ted’s gone, you won’t ever be. Joe can’t run things anymore with his heart condition. So... Julie finally starts to get steamed.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You know what, Mrs. Tunnie? There’s only one thing I miss.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TUNNIE
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Dancing in Vegas. I miss shaking my bare ass for men like your husband.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TUNNIE
dialogues.text: I knew it! Where there’s smoke, there’s fire. If you’re smart you’11 cut your losses and move on while you can, missy! (calls to captain) We’re done here, Jose. As the houseboat slowly pulls out, Zack steps up beside Julie.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: You really danced in Vegas?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Nope. Think I ought to give it a try? (Zack grins) Don’t answer that. Julie secures the gas line. Jacob steps up and takes over for her.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Let me grab that for you, kid.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Don’t let that old gas bag get to you. Her and her old man have been trying to get their hands on this pier for twenty years now.  23.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Well, they’1l have to wait another twenty as far as I’m concerned.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: That’s my girl.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: I’ve got to take out that charter. You need anything?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I’m fine. Just keep it simple with those kids, okay? She tosses Zack the boat keys.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: No worries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Patterson’s excursion boat, the “Chill Pill” cuts acr the calm waters of Havasu with Marcus at the helm. Taylor Reggie and the girls are lounging on the open deck as Zac helps them prep for the dive. Zack helps J.C. slip on her tank. He adjusts the harness.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Too tight? J.C. No, it’s fine. I didn’t think air could be this heavy.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Once you’re in the water, you won’t even know it’s there. J.C. Hold on a sec. She adjusts a neoprene knee brace.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Bad knee? J.C. Just gotta take care of it. I tore some cartilage swimming.  24.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: What kind of swimming? J.C. I compete for Arizona State. I’1ll be fine as long as I don’t push it.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: As far as I’m concerned, the whole point of diving is not pushing it. It’s about going with the flow. I think you’re gonna love it. J.C. Why do you?

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: What? J.C. Love it so much. I can see it in your face when you talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: (adjusts her harness) I dunno. It’s kind of like flying. No, it’s more like... a dream of flying. You’re weightless, gliding through this secret world where all you can hear is your own breathing. And no one else can see what you see. J.C. You must dive alone a lot.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: ...guess I do. Reggie interrupts, dropping his tank down with a loud CLA

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: Hey man, this regulator’s fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Should be okay. I checked it this morning. Reggie strains to turn the valve.  25.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: Well, you didn’t check this. I can’t work with this cheap crap.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Lemme see. Zack turns the valve in the opposite direction Reggie’s b turning it. We instantly hear the HISS of air coming thro the line.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: This is different than the gear we train with.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Sure. The Seals probably use valves that twist in the wrong direction to like, foil terrorists, right? Reggie fumes. Marcus cuts the engines and trips the ancho release.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (over intercom) Ladies and gentlemen, this is your captain speaking. Please stow your tray tables in their upright position. We have arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat drifts to a stop, revealing a picturesque hidden cove. Red rock walls tower above placid water. Zack slips overboard into waist-deep water.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Okay. wWe’ll stop for a quick lesson and still have plenty of dive time before lunch.

dialogues.speaker: SYDNEY
dialogues.text: (admires view) »..not bad.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Cabo’s nicer.

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE
dialogues.text: This sucks. Can we try someplace else?  26. J.C. (slips into the water) C’mon, Cami, it’s beautiful. The water’s perfect.

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE
dialogues.text: (displays phone) No reception.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You just might have to talk to us in person without A.T. & T. involved. Zack plunks the gear down on shore. J.C. notices somethin J.C. Look at that...

dialogues.speaker: SHORELINE
dialogues.text: J.C. hops up into the old tire swing. Now we know they’ve dropped anchor right were Ted Patterson disappeared. J.C. begins to swing. The old rope CREAKS under her weigh

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Hey! Don’t do that! J.C. Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: That thing’s like twenty, thirty years old. I don’t want you to fall on your... um. J.C. My ass? Taylor wades up onto shore.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: And a fine ass it is. (to Zack) Calm down there, Aqua Boy. You don’t want to pop a stiffy in your speedo.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Havasu doesn’t have the crystal clear waters of the Caribbean, but it does have its own unique beauty. The “atmosphere” of the water carries breathtaking shafts of light that ripple across the perfect bodies of J.C. and h girlfriends as they gracefully descend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack puts the college kids through some of the basics; Flooding their face masks, then learning how to blow them clear without surfacing. “Buddy Breathing,” in which two divers alternate off of o tank. Reggie breaks rank to play grabass with Sydney. Zack and J.C. glide weightlessly along the incline of the rocky slope. J.C. spreads her arms like wings to “fly” fo Zack. Taylor gets Zack’s attention, showing him that his regula is reading in the red (low air time). Zack scribbles ona hand-sized MARKER BOARD. It reads: “Relax. You're Hyperventilating.” ANGLE J.C. She’s noticed something peculiar a short distance ahead. immediately recognize the RIFT, the deep crevice that swallowed Ted Patterson alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sand along the rim is slowly, but constantly tricklin inward, disappearing into the dark void within. It’sa subtle but weird phenomenon. J.C. glides over for a closer look

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: As he turns, realizing he’s lost sight of J.C... then he spots her.

dialogues.speaker: THE RIFT
dialogues.text: J.C. swims down towards the rift, gracefully passing thro a shaft of rippling light. The second she’s over the open crevice, she’s violently sucked down into it.  28.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK REACTS
dialogues.text: He drops his hand board and swims with all his might, bla straight to J.C.

dialogues.speaker: THE RIFT
dialogues.text: J.C. desperately clutches a rocky outcropping as the unde drags her inside. Nothing but a slippery hand hold keeps from being swallowed up by the darkness. INT. RIFT - SONAR P.O.V. An eerie SONAR image of J.C., as she’s seen by something inside the rift. She appears as a softly strobing silhouette, constantly scanned and rescanned by radiating sonar waves. A small figure in a vast black limbo. The P.O.V. rushes straight up at the struggling J.C.

dialogues.speaker: THE RIFT
dialogues.text: J.C.’s hand slips and she’s jerked inside. But she snags second hand hold. Frantic, she looks back over her shoulder, into the darkn Her dive mask is RIPPED from her face by the relentless current. She slips a few more inches, now blinded. SONAR P.O.V. Rushing straight at J.C.’s feet C.U. - J.C.’S HAND White knuckled grip. She hangs on... but the rock gives w

dialogues.speaker: CA-RUNCH
dialogues.text: J.C. disappears into the darkness. But Zack’s hand thrust into the rift and grabs her forearm.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: He straddles the rift, fighting tons of water pressure. H pulls all his might... and J.C. slowly begins to appear, by inch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack manages to get J.C. past the outer edge of the crevi The grip of the relentless undertow is suddenly broken an Zack and J.C. sling shot away.  29. Zack takes J.C.’s hand and quickly leads her to the surfa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie sips a cup of coffee as she leans against the weath railing, gazing out at the sparkling reflections of the l afternoon light on the water. As she watches, Julie notices an odd turbulence on the la surface. It’s distant, but still noticeable. Julie slips on her UV sunglasses. JULIE’S P.O.V. The image is cleaner. There is definitely something odd about the disturbance on the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie walks a few feet down the dock and grabs a pair of binoculars from a tackle box. She scans the water, but is now past the safety railing, perched on the edge of the d JULIE’S P.0.V. - BINOCULARS A water skier, a young girl, is heading toward the patch turbulence.

dialogues.speaker: WATER
dialogues.text: A tracking shot from in the water as Julie watches. Something is watching her. There is a growing sense of dr about what lies in wait for Julie. Julie GASPS as the ski girl crosses the odd patch of wate and WIPES OUT, disappearing in a spray of water. C.U. - JULIE’S FEET Julie, engrossed in the view through her binoculars, step dangerously close to the edge of the dock. BINOCULAR - P.O.V. The girl does not surface for one, two, three seconds... empty skis pop up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie slips, losing her balance.

dialogues.speaker: A HAND
dialogues.text: Shoots out of nowhere, grabbing Julie’s forearm... pullin her back to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s Nate, the pet store owner. Julie recovers, still ups by what she’s seen.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Nate... you startled me.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (awkward) Oh, sorry! I, uh... you almost fell in. Julie glances back at the scene. The ski girl finally surfaces, laughing. Her friends in the boat pick her up. All is perfectly normal.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I just thought I better stop by and service the aquarium. I figure since Ted’s... well, since he’s not around, I...

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (pulls herself together) That’s sweet of you, Nate. C’mon in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Julie enter.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I’m really very sorry about Ted.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I haven’t given up. I won’t until I know what happened to him.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You’11 find him. TI know you will. If there’s anything I can do... anything. Just let me know.  31.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Of course, Nate. Nate is left in a totally awkward state.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I’ll... just, you know, check the PH. The angel fish, they’re tricky.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Okay, then. Nate finally turns and hurries off to the safer world of fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Looking Glass pulls into its sloop. Jacob greats them and expertly ties off the tow lines.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: How was the dive?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (hops off) Great, except for the part where your instructor almost got my friend killed. Marcus guides it into its slip at the Patterson dock. Zac helps J.C. step off the boat. She’s still badly shaken fr the misadventure.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: There’s an emergency ward five minutes from here, I can... J.C. I told you, Zack. I’m okay.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Just to make sure. J.C. This is already embarrassing enough... really, I’m fine.  32.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You’re the one who’s got problems, aqua-boy. My dad specializes in injury law. wWe’re going to own that boat, this dock and every dime you make for the rest of your natural life.

dialogues.speaker: SYDNEY
dialogues.text: Taylor, try not to think about money for five minutes, okay? Reggie confronts Zack as he off-loads the tanks.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: So that was your “sweet dive spot?” Fuckin’ idiot.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Back off man.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: Next time we go out, I run the dive.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Before you get somebody hurt, maybe your friends here oughta know the closest you’ve ever been to the Seals is at Marine World.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: You don’t know shit.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Really? Better tell the guy who did your tat that the “e” in Seals comes before the “a.” Reggie stops in his tracks and checks the tattoo on his bicep. A shocked look crosses his face.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: What?! That stupid shit! Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: (ice cold) The tattoo’s fine; but you’re no Seal. (beat) My brother was a Seal. You couldn’t shine his shoes.  33. Zack walks off towards the dive shop, leaving Reggie completely flustered. The girls begin to giggle.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (laughs) Oh, man, you are so busted.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: (calls after Zack) You’re dead meat, trailer trash!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack and Marcus stow the dive gear as they discuss the incident with Julie.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Sounds like you got caught in some kind of suck hole. When I was a kid we had to watch out for them along the California coast

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: But this is a lake, not the ocean. (to Zack) Are you even sure what you saw down there?

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: The girl almost got killed, okay Marcus?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: How do you know that? If the undertow was that strong it couldn’t be constant. Unless it’s just “the black hole that eternally sucks.” (pauses) No, wait... that’s my life.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (pauses) You think you could find it again?

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: (shrugs) It was hard to see when I was right on top of it. I could try.  34.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What’s the point? Just stay away from it.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: The point is... if it happened to you, it could have happened to Ted. A chill goes through every person in the room, as they realize that Julie is right.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: (softly) Even if it did, he would have never survived this long...

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I know that. (beat) If he is down there, I can’t just leave him. We’ve got to bring him home. Zack begins to choke up.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Yeah... you’re right.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: There could be air.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You never saw this rift before that little tremor on Thursday, right?

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Right. Which is very weird because we dive there all the time.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: If there’s a strong current, it may be that something large opened up.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: If it is one of these lakes... is it possible that it could have an air pocket?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Oh, I don’t know about that...  35. Phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Nate, there’s a call for you.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No one knows I’m here.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It’s your mother. She says the Sheriff’s Department is looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (panics) What?! Tell her... tell her I’m not here. Tell her...

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: You in trouble, Nate?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No. Not that I know of...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (hands him the phone) Go ahead. Don’t worry, I can hook you up with a good lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello, ma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA BOOMS DOWN from the upper deck of the houseboat, w the girls are greased up, catching some rays. Someone’s m player is plugged into a boom box. Reggae/Rap BLARES. CAMERA ENDFRAMES on the rail of the lower deck. Reggie si on a lounge chair, puffing on a Cuban cigar. Taylor appears and sets some cold Coronas in the tub of i beside Reggie. He sits in a lounge beside Reggie.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We need to talk.  36.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: Sure... about what?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: The girls.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: They’re hot, right?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yeah. But I thought you said they’d want to party.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: They do. You just gotta get them in the mood.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: The mood is about a grand a day of my money. Which is starting to get irritating. Tell them if I was looking for new buddies, I’d have joined a softball team.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: C’mon, man. These are sorority girls. You don’t want to freak them out.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. But if this keeps up, I’m going to have to have a funeral for my dick.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: Which one do you like?

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: You make her nervous. Camille is more your type. Concentrate on Camille.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: No, J.C. Lets figure out how to make her un-nervous. Reggie reaches into his pocket and pulls out a slip of paper... the Club Zanzibar hand out.  37.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: Here, check this out.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: A very hot Fourth of July party tomorrow night. Supposed to get seriously wild. If that doesn’t loosen the girls up, I’ve got something special that’1l chill J.C. out for you.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: For real? Reggie reaches into his backpack and tosses Taylor a smal aspirin tin.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: For emergency use only. Two in her margarita and she’s yours.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Is it safe?

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: (shrugs) You're not taking ‘em, bro. She is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Deputy Sheriff steers the Fish and Game Department’s boat. Sheriff Dobbs stands beside Dale, scanning the coastline of this rugged end of the lake. Nate sits idly behind them.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: I’m not sure I understand this son. How do you lose an entire horse?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Something just dragged it down. (softly) I didn’t know a horse could scream.  38.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Technically, they do. If you know what to listen for, they also laugh and cry. In fact, a number of mammals do, including dolphins and elephants.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Spare us the Discovery Channel B.S., Nate. We’re just trying to piece together what happened here. You’re the only horse expert we got.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I supply feed for the dude ranch but... actually, my specialty is tropical fish.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: (irritated) Fine. Do you happen to have an opinion about what this boy has been telling us?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Well... It’s awfully shallow here for a healthy horse to drown. Might have broken a leg and spooked.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: That’s not what happened.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: There’s the boathouse. The Deputy slows the engines. The boathouse is clearly abandoned, it’s dilapidated pier half-submerged in the wa The familiar TIRE SWING is prominent on the shoreline.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: It was in here somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What’s that? The Sheriff follows Nate’s gaze. Only rocks and seaweed a visible beneath the boat.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: What?  39.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. Circle around... The Deputy swings the boat in a tight 360. This time he c the engines and they drift along in silence. Nate scans t lake bed.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Right there... He leans out over the side of the boat to get a better lo SONAR P.O.V. From below... scanning Nate as he leans out. The sun behi Nate flares, obliterating the image.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Half hidden in the shallows, a piece of metal GLINTS in t sunlight... a stirrup.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Right there. Nate slips over the side into waist-deep water. The terra beneath the water is rough. The rotted wood of the old boathouse’s dilapidated pier makes it tricky.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: (to Deputy) For Christ’s sake, Jerry. Give him a hand. The Deputy slips off his t-shirt and tosses it in the boa submerges in the shallow water.

dialogues.speaker: SIMULTANEOUS
dialogues.text: The Deputy grabs the stirrup and pulls. Whatever the stra is attached to, it’s firmly hooked up under wooden debris

dialogues.speaker: SURFACE
dialogues.text: The Deputy comes up for air, gasping.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: It’s hung up on something. Nate wades over beside the Deputy.  40. EXT. UNDERWATER - SONAR P.O.V. In eerie, softly glowing SONAR VISION, The Deputy reaches right into CAMERA to get a grip on the stirrup. Whatever is watching The Deputy, it’s so close that it’s strange he doesn’t see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Deputy and Nate strain against the stubborn stirrup.. suddenly, with the CRUNCH of wood, a large SHADOWY MASS breaks free.

dialogues.speaker: SURFACE
dialogues.text: Nate tumbles backwards into a section of rotted wood. It crumbles on impact. CRUNCH-SPLASH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HORSE’S GRISLY BONES burst to the surface in a cluste around Nate... he scrambles to free himself, tangled up i old net that has snagged the remains. The Deputy helps Nate out of the tangle of rancid bones a netting. The Sheriff observes from the side of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Fine! I’m fine. The Deputy heaves the saddle up into the boat and the men climb back on board. The Sheriff grabs a small camera fro his gear and snaps a picture of the bones.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: How long ago did you say this happened?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Last night.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Looks more like last week. Those bones have been stripped clean. The shredded SADDLE looks as if it’s been through a wood chipper.  41.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: What the hell could have done this?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I have no idea... The Sheriff gets a shot of the saddle as the Deputy inspe the straps, ripped into ribbons of leather. Water pours o of the torn saddle bag...

dialogues.speaker: SHOCK CUT
dialogues.text: A DARK SHAPE explodes out of the saddle bag... right at Dale’s throat. Jaws SNAP! Dale SCREAMS as arterial blood sprays out in a gruesome arc. The Deputy grabs the dark, glistening CREATURE and yanks off Dale’s blood-splattered neck. It’s tail whiplashes as flies overboard and disappears beneath the surface. Dale scrambles away, gripping his throat, but the blood s squirts out with each heartbeat The Sheriff grabs a towel and presses it to the open hole

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Sit back! You’ve got to lie still. The Sheriff applies direct pressure to the shocking wound

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: (to Deputy) Get us out of here. The Deputy guns the engines.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: (to Nate) You want to tell me what the hell that was?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I didn’t get a very good look, I...

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: You said you were a fish expert. Find out. And find out soon. Nate sits... and notices the Sheriff’s digital camera lyi beside him.  42. The image of the waterlogged saddle is frozen on the view screen. A dark BLUR has been captured on the lower right edge of the shot... the creature leaping from the saddle Nate takes the camera and punches the screen controls ZOOMING IN on the image. Although it’s dark and distorted, the creature’s gruesome profile is visible. Rows of horrid fangs and a white, glaring eye are visible within the ghastly blur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus pulls up in front of the Sand Bar in his 70’s Shel Cobra. It would be a classic, but it’s more bondo than Cobra. As Marcus exits the car, he notices an orange state- sanctioned PICKUP parked near the bar’s retaining wall. Two men, STATE GEOLOGISTS, are checking the pylons that support the bar’s outdoor deck that hangs over the water. Marcus is immediately concerned. He tries to look casual he saunters over to the pair.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: GEOLOGIST
dialogues.text: Are you the owner?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (lies) I’m his partner.

dialogues.speaker: GEOLOGIST
dialogues.text: Wwe’ve been spot-checking some of the public buildings since that quake.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Wasn’t much of a quake, though, was it?

dialogues.speaker: GEOLOGIST
dialogues.text: Three point eight. But the numbers can be misleading. Looks like you have some baseline damage on your pylons.  43.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Really? You sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: GEOLOGIST
dialogues.text: The damage might not be structural. We’1l have county engineers out here sometime next week to do a more thorough assessment. In the meantime, you’d best keep people off that deck. The Geologist fills out a form and hands it to Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: GEOLOGIST
dialogues.text: Call us if you have any questions.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I get it. Better to be safe than sorry.

dialogues.speaker: GEOLOGIST
dialogues.text: Exactly. You have a good holiday.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You too, sir. Thanks. Marcus watches as the Geologists return to their truck. H waves at them as they pull out onto the main road. As soon as they’re out of sight, Marcus balls up the noti and tosses it in a trash can.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: And you can kiss my sweet Irish cheeks until Sunday morning. He stuffs it in his pocket and slaps on of his club flyer the door in it’s place; “Club Zanzabar - Party Down on th Fourth.”

dialogues.speaker: C.U.
dialogues.text: He’s standing in the rear of a speedboat. This is PLAYBAC of a digital tape. Julie is operating the digital cam, so can hear her voice, but she’s not in the shot. She’s in t midst of a playful “interview” with Ted.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (V.0. - TV)
dialogues.text: So, Mr. Patterson, as a famous deep sea diver...  44.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Lake diver. That’s a lake behind me.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (V.0. - TV)
dialogues.text: Okay, whatever. “Deep lake diver,” to what do you attribute your great success?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I owe it all to the little people. Specifically the little five-foot- two girl in the red bikini right here. (grabs off cam at Julie) Now suit up. CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal Julie, curled up on her couch with Baxter watching the playback on her TV.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (V.0. - TV)
dialogues.text: I told you I don’t do scuba. You guys dive, I’11 make lunch.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What are you scared of?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (V.0. - TV)
dialogues.text: Everything. I’11 be so slow, you’11 end up leaving me behind.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (suddenly serious) Listen, I will never, ever leave you alone down there, understand? Now go get your gear on... Ted playfully SNAPS his towel somewhere below the frameli The camera goes cock-eyed as Julie shrieks with LAUGHTER. EXT. JULIE’S CABIN - LAKEFRONT - NIGHT The sounds of the playback of Julie’s laughter ECHOES acr the moonlit lake. The swirling TURBULENCE briefly appears the surface of the water, a larger more defined arrowhead motion... then all is still again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The houseboat is docked for the night at a remote pier. Laughter and music can be heard from inside.  45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.C. is painting her toenails. Camille is chatting on her cell phone. Reggie and Sydney begin necking shamelessly o the couch. Taylor enters with a pitcher of margaritas puffing on a joint.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Hey, we gave you two the master so we wouldn’t have to watch the miracle of creation.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: (mumble) Fuck off...

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Jackie? I’m losing you... Camille rises, trying to find a “sweet spot” for receptio Taylor pours J.C. a margarita and offers her a puff of th joint. J.C. No thanks. Taylor picks up her nail polish bottle and takes a whiff.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: No wonder. You already copped a buzz off of this shit. Camille mimes her irritation.

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Sorry, I can’t hear you. People are talking in here.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: That’s our primary form of communication on this planet. I/’1l phone you sometime and explain it Camille exits in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille steps out onto the pier, searching for reception.  46. Three drunk FRAT BOYS are lounging on a speedboat docked the next slip. They try to get Camille to join them as sh passes by, but she won’t have anything to do with them. S remains focused on her cell phone, panning it like she’s searching for gold with a metal detector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille slips off the pier into warm waist-deep water.

dialogues.speaker: E.C.U.
dialogues.text: Camille sees the phone’s reception bars multiply from zer three...

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE
dialogues.text: (softly) Yesss... She wades further out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In eerie, undulating SONAR VISION, we see Camille's lower torso wade out into deeper water. The P.O.V. is distant, approaching fast.

dialogues.speaker: CAMILLE
dialogues.text: She’s still casting about for reception... slows to a sto UNDERWATER P.O.V. As Camille stops walking, her sonar image disappears like ghost. Whatever this “vision” is, it only works on moving targets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the frat boys has followed Camille to the edge of dock. He watches her, admiring her body... but then notic something strange. The TURBULENCE flickers across the surface of the water, heading straight for her

dialogues.speaker: FRAT BOY
dialogues.text: whey. Camille is still preoccupied, trying to get a call out. S remains standing in place, punching her send button.  47.

dialogues.speaker: FRAT BOY
dialogues.text: (louder ) Hey! Camille finally looks up, irritated at the interruption.

dialogues.speaker: FRAT BOY
dialogues.text: (softly, intensely) Don’t move. Camille recognizes the fear in his voice. Something is wrong. Very wrong. She glances down at the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. of Camille as she looks down in horror all around he CAMERA rapidly BOOMS UP until it’s directly overhead, revealing an IMMENSE SHADOW circling Camille beneath the surface. It could be the Loch Ness Monster... or hundreds Piranha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, it completely encircles her. UNDERWATER - PIRANHA P.O.V. SONAR VISION is receiving scattershot images; a section o the uneven lake bottom, a bit of Camille’s calf, a sectio the pier’s pylons. As long as she holds still, the target unclear. E.C.U. - CAMILLE’S CELL PHONE The L.E.D. display lights up with a message; INCOMING CAL Beat. The phone RINGS LOUDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHADOW RING of piranha instantly responds to the RING attacks Camille! The water EXPLODES all around her as she jerked beneath the surface.

dialogues.speaker: C.U.
dialogues.text: Watches in stunned disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see lights clicking OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.C. is nearly asleep on a fold out bed when Sydney enter She looks exhausted and is carrying a pillow and a blanke

dialogues.speaker: SYDNEY
dialogues.text: Reggie snores like a fucking lion. Mind if I crash on the couch? J.C. No. Go ahead. Is Camille back yet?

dialogues.speaker: SYDNEY
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Not that I know of. She must have finally made her love connection. J.C. Her what?

dialogues.speaker: SYDNEY
dialogues.text: Look, I love Camille. But she’s the queen of booty calls. why do you think she’s always on the phone? The girl’s quicker on delivery than Domino's. J.C. You sure she’s okay?

dialogues.speaker: SYDNEY
dialogues.text: You’1l see. She’1l probably show up at the party tomorrow with some hot guy. Maybe two. J.C. Maybe three.

dialogues.speaker: SYDNEY
dialogues.text: Great. Then I can finally ditch Reggie. I think all those steroids are starting to take the lead out of his pencil. The girls giggle and high five. J.C. clicks off the light  49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB assists Julie and Zack as they load diving gear int the glass bottom boat, preparing to search for the rift. Baxter the dog is excitedly running up and down the dock.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ahoy, there! Julie turns. Nate marches out onto the dock, wearing a ba boating hat and carrying an overstuffed beach tote. Baxte BARKS a joyful greeting and dances around Nate as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Oh no, Zack. You didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Not me. He invited himself.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (calls out) Morning!

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (half-hearted) Hi, Nate. Nate holds up his duffel, stuffed full.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Brought my gear. I just thought you could use some help.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: It’s sweet of you to offer, but we have no idea if we’ll find anything.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (softly) He was a good man. I just... (awkward) Well, I’d like to help, if I can...

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (considers) Of course, Nate. Climb aboard. Jacob grabs his duffel, helps him board.  50.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: So how was your big meeting with the Sheriff?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Very strange indeed. He needed my advice.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Is he interested in fish?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: He is now. But I’m not so sure I can help him.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Alright, grab a seat, everybody. Baxter leaps on board just in time as Julie pulls the boa out of it’s slip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KER-SLASH! Zack drops the anchor overboard. They’ve reach the remote cove. Julie passes out compact high-beam flashlights.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You put in the fresh batteries?

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Yeah. (tests his light) This’1l be like looking for a needle in a haystack.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Try this... Jacob tosses Zack an UNDERWATER FLARE from a cardboard bo

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: That’s a hell of a lot brighter than your flashlight; but they’re only good for about fifteen minutes. Just crack the cap... and keep it away from your face.  51. Zack casually inspects his flare, but does a double-take Nate steps up from the aft of the boat. Nate has donned a surprisingly flashy red and yellow wets with a large NO FEAR logo down the arm.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (off Zack’s reaction) What? It was a gift. Jacob hands Nate a flare. Nate handles it gingerly.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Sorry. It’s just that I’m a little claustrophobic, so if we do finda cavern...

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (takes back the flare) That’s okay. We don’t expect you to go in.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: But I’ve got your back.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Good to know.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: One by one Julie, Zack and Jacob plunge into the water an begin their descent.

dialogues.speaker: SEARCH FOR THE RIFT
dialogues.text: They methodically cover the lake bed... gliding over sand rock as they seek the rift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus is busy making preparations for his party. A waitress, a bus boy and CARRIE the bartender, are helping out.  52. CARRIE is a tough, buff biker chick in her late twenties everybody’s favorite bartender.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: What kind of crowd are we expecting?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: The kind with cash... and plenty of it, I hope. RODRIGUEZ, the owner, steps out onto the deck.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
dialogues.text: Hey, Marcus, we got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
dialogues.text: Your D.J.’s people are here.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: So what’s the problem?

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
dialogues.text: They want to know where to put their gear. We now hear the WHINING of heavy machinery and two roadie appear on a FORK LIFT PLATFORM as it rises into frame. A huge stack of amps and a set of SPOTLIGHTS are lifted t deck level. In the B.G., two vans and a large generator truck have just begun to unload. CAMERA BOOMS DOWN from Marcus’ stunned reaction... down p the structure of the deck... to the PYLONS that support i above the water. A small chip of plaster falls off the hairline FRACTURE o the center pylon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baxter is poised at the bow of the boat... ears perked as patiently waits for his mistress. The sun is dangerously on the horizon.  53.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Julie, Zack and Jacob continue their search, gliding acro the lake bottom.

dialogues.speaker: THE RIFT
dialogues.text: Zack and Jacob glide down and settle beside the rift. Jac raises a hand, cautioning Julie back He digs his hand into the lake bottom and releases a hand of sand over the rift. It plumes out, then is suddenly sucked inside by the powerful undertow. The current is on Julie nods, she understands. Jacob checks the rock formation for a solid spot, then unslings a rock hammer from his dive belt and pounds a ST PITON into the bedrock. Zack does the same. They clip nylon lines to the pitons and secure them to th dive belts. Jacob shows Nate how to tend to the coils of line. Nate gives an exaggerated thumbs up. Julie CRACKS off the end of her flare, which ignites its magnesium core. A bright blue incandescent LIGHT illumina their surroundings. She looks to Jacob. He CRACKS his flare, moving in right behind her. Julie pushes out over the rift, holding the flare before her... In an instant she is swept inside by the powerful current. Her nylon line quickly plays out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie tumbles inside, ripped head over heels by the power backwash. She slowly regains control and drifts to a stop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gazes up in awe at the vista before her, illuminated the ghostly flicker of her flare. Zack shoots into the cavern right behind her. Jacob’s las  54. JULIE’S P.O.V. - UNDERGROUND LAKE The vast ceiling of the underwater cavern is breathtaking Sistine Chapel of ancient rock arcing out into darkness. This place may have existed undisturbed for centuries. Julie glances back at Zack and Jacob, who are equally in All are humbled by the sheer size of this place. There are several HOLLOWS in the cavern walls, which may may not be passages. Julie and Zack glide forward, pausin at each hollow to briefly illuminate its interior with th flares... searching for any sign of Ted Patterson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Julie, Zack and Jacob pass by, SWARMS OF PIRANHA are revealed, watching from the shadows within the hollows. T hover just beyond the ring of light from the flares. The ghostly forms rise and fall with an eerie grace, stay just out of sight as our heroes slowly swim past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baxter stands poised at the bow of the boat, waiting patiently for his master.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, boy. They’re okay. Nate sits in the bow with his laptop open and scrolling through a site titled “National Oceanographic Society” Th program is in the midst of a search titled “Fresh Water F Characteristics.” On the lower quadrant of the screen is a scan of the Sheriff’s photo of the mystery fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate carefully overlays the blurred image with green reference points that detail the fish’s facial characteristics. A glowing grid connects the dots. Nate presses a button and the program begins to rapidly search hundreds of images from the site... seeking a matc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack, Jacob and Julie swim along with their flickering torches held before them. The cavern has narrowed down to winding tunnel filled with rocky arches and dark hollows. Jacob motions to Julie, showing her that their lifelines nearly played out. As Julie checks her line, the light from her flare falls a beautiful little SEAHORSE, unlike anything she’s seen before. It GLOWS with a soft phosphorescence and its entire body translucent. Its fluttering heart and organs all look as they’re made of glass. It circles around them, its delicate fins whirring like humming bird wings. It’s followed by another half-dozen o its kind, all glowing like something out of a fairy tale. As Julie watches, the seahorses skim across the sandy flo passing over something metallic in the sand... something made. Julie starts towards it, but is pulled up short as her ny cord goes taut. They’ve reached the end of their lifeline She glances back at Zack, then makes a decision. Julie unclips her line and continues forward. Zack is obviously concerned. He looks back JACOB’S P.O.V. Their lines trail off into the dark murky void. Zack reluctantly unclips his line and follows Julie.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAVERN FLOOR
dialogues.text: Julie dusts the sand away from Ted’s cracked DIVE MASK. S glances at Zack. Whatever Ted Patterson’s fate was, they’ getting closer to finding out. A ripple runs through the swarms of piranhas in their positions throughout the hollows. The natives are restles but they still avoid the radiant nimbus of light that encircles the divers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baxter begins to WHINE, pacing up and down along the side the boat. Nate is getting nervous as well.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry boy, they’1l be back soon. Nate now hears a soft BEEP TONE from his computer, glance back at the screen...

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (softly) Damn...

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: The program flashes NO MATCH. A question appears on the screen; “Alternate Search.” Nate checks the box marked “scale twelve inches” to “any scale.” The search instantl flashes to a MATCH. The gruesome profile of a BRAZILIAN FRESHWATER PIRANHA fi the screen. It’s a close match to the photo... only our f is twice the size and three times as nasty looking.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (whispers) Sweet Jesus with a tambourine... Nate clicks “more” and is hit with dozens and dozens of images... each more gruesome than the next of the vicious species. The tiny, evil eyes, disproportionately large fangs, the distinctive underbite. An mpeg suddenly appear and begins to playback a jittery black and white film cli

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: In the crude image, an ox is led by Brazilian ranch hands into a swiftly flowing river. As it steps into the water, time code appears in the corner, counting the seconds. At first, nothing happens. Then the ox suddenly collapses into the water. The water around the oxen now churns violently. It’s head breaks the surface, braying in pain. The moment the time code hits twenty-seven seconds it FREEZES. Ox bones bob up to the surface, picked clean of flesh.  57.

dialogues.speaker: C.U.
dialogues.text: He’s thunderstruck as he realizes;

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Nate tangled in the horse’s bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate rises, nervously pacing back and forth. Baxter BARKS picking up on Nate’s indecision and fear. Nate glances at the extra oxygen tanks. The box of flares. He knows he should warn Julie. Baxter BARKS.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I can’t! I told them, I can’t go in there. They’1ll just have to... Nate’s voice trails off. He’s stuck between a rock and a hard place of sheer terror... and the sun is setting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack’s flickering torch reveals a blocked passage. Dead e He turns back to Jacob and Julie... now what? At that moment, Zack’s torch begins to SPUTTER. Zack fumbles for the flashlight clipped to his belt, just a_swarm of PIRANHA rises up from the hollows behind him. Dozens of sightless eyes reflect the dying light as they up out of the darkness. Zack’s flare finally goes out. Julie grabs Zack’s arm, pulling him back. The swarm surge forward in a swirling mass! Julie holds her flare higher, briefly driving them back, then her flare begins to sputter Icy fear grips Julie as she realizes their situation. She turns back, looking for any other escape route. JULIE’S P.O.V. By the last cold-blue flicker of Julie’s light, the caver walls appear to move. Hundreds of piranha line the walls. They rustle like leaves in the wind, their metallic scale GLISTENING. Julie, Zack and Jacob are completely surround  58. Then Julie’s flare sputters out. The entire cavern is plunged into PITCH BLACK. Zack’s FLASHLIGHT BEAM finally flashes ON, stabbing throu the darkness... It’s too damn narrow and too dim, but it reveals our worst fears;

dialogues.speaker: SHOCK CUT
dialogues.text: A cloud of piranhas, swirl around them, closing in for th kill. They tear into the closest target... Jacob. Zack watches in horror as Jacob is ripped to pieces befor his eyes... still alive and SCREAMING as the gleaming whi bones of his rib cage are stripped bare. The fish go berserk, tails lashing and fangs snapping. Jacob’s blood billows out in a dark cloud as his limbs ar ripped from his torso. The power and speed of their attac is absolutely terrifying.

dialogues.speaker: CAVERN
dialogues.text: Zack discovers his light beam has the effect of a Star Wa “light saber.” It repels the fish as it strikes them. But Zack is fighting a losing battle as the swarm grows around them... becoming more aggressive with every heartb Julie’s light beam FLASHES on, as Jacob spins about in pa caught up in a living twister of piranhas. His blood stir the piranhas into a greater frenzy. Julie tries to help, but is quickly forced to fend off he own attackers. She flashes her light in their eyes to tur them away. Zack turns and the beam reveals a huge SWELL of piranha surging straight towards him. Zack backpedals in the darkness and collides with a caver wall. His flashlight is knocked from his grasp and tumble into the darkness below. Zack immediately swims straight down... trying to catch it Julie swims for her life in a blind panic, deeper into th cavern. The swarm splits; half whirls about to pursue Jul half dive bombs after Zack.  59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack swims straight down into this natural well of icy water... and the swarm swoops down right after him. Zack’s flashlight tumbles down through the darkness, its bouncing off the craggy walls. Zack is in a deadly race... straight to the bottom of thi natural well, with the swarm right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie swims for her life. The pitch black cavern has now narrowed into a winding tunnel. Julie’s legs are scraped the razor sharp walls, leaving a trail of blood behind he Piranha swarm into the tunnel from both directions. Teeth and eyes FLASH up out of pitch blackness, cutting off her escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the last second, Julie ducks into a narrow hollow in t cavern wall. The two swarms COLLIDE into one another, just missing Jul The fish attack each other in their killing frenzy, quick filling the tunnel with dark blood and bits of flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie swims for all she’s worth, heading straight up a na “stove pipe” passage. It grows narrower as it twists and turns... growing more and more claustrophobic. Julie now hears the eerie SOUND of the swarm approaching, leathery SNAP of tails accompanied by an almost sublimina banshee WAIL. Julie twists about, scraping the narrow walls as she chec behind her with her flashlight. JULIE’S P.O.V. Hundreds of piranha streak straight up, completely fillin the narrow “stove pipe” passage.  60.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Turns back... and bumps straight into a GRISLY CORPSE. Ha a body blocks her path, a grinning skull beneath a dive m She instinctively flinches backwards, but the sound of th piranha grows LOUDER and LOUDER. Julie grabs the corpse. Could this be Ted? There’s no tim to think. The corpse pulls free, falling to pieces and Ju swims straight through it!

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: The piranha race straight up through the narrow funnel of rock.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Pure adrenaline empowers her. She desperately swims/scram up the jagged walls. JULIE’S TANK SLAMS into solid rock. She’s caught! The passage is simpl too tight to make it through. She SLAMS into the ring of solid rock again and again, bu she’s stuck like a cork in a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: THE SWARM
dialogues.text: A living wall of teeth rockets up the rocky chute and tea into the flesh of Julie’s legs!

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: She SCREAMS, losing her mouthpiece. The pain is excruciating. She panics, gulping water, only seconds lef to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie releases her harness. She pulls free of her tank... swims straight up with no oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: THE PIRANHA
dialogues.text: In their frenzy, they attack the oxygen tank. We hear the metallic SCREECH as teeth scrape on metal.  61.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
